com.ti.debug.engine.scripting

Interface IDebugServerEventListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.EventListener

    public interface IDebugServerEventListener
extends java.util.EventListener

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isSafeToStart(DebugSession session)
      Once DSS has opened a debug session (after the onSessionOpening/Opened() events have been fired) it will call into this function and wait inside a "busy-loop" until isSafeToStart() returns true (or until a timeout occurs).
      boolean isSafeToTerminate(DebugSession session)
      Prior to DSS terminating a session (prior to the onSessionTerminating/Terminated() events being fired) it will call into this function and wait inside a "busy-loop" until safeToTerminate() returns true (or until a timeout occurs).
      void onServerStarted(DebugServer server)
      This event is fired during the call to DebugServer.start(), immediatly *after* the call to IApplication.initialize().
      void onServerStarting(DebugServer server)
      This event is fired during the call to DebugServer.start(), *before* loading and initializing the underlying IApplication.
      void onServerStopped(DebugServer server)
      This event is fired during the call to DebugServer.stop(), immediatly *after* the call to IApplication.dispose().
      void onServerStopping(DebugServer server)
      This event is fired during the call to DebugServer.stop(), *before* terminating any DebugSessions and *before* disposing the underlying IApplication.
      void onSessionOpened(DebugSession session)
      This event is fired during a call to DebugServer.openSession(), *after* the new session is opened (and cached).
      void onSessionOpening(java.lang.String sessionName, java.lang.String configuration)
      This event is fired during a call to DebugServer.openSession(), *before* a new session is opened.
      void onSessionTerminated(DebugSession session)
      This event is fired during a call to DebugSession.terminate(), *after* the session has been terminated.
      void onSessionTerminating(DebugSession session)
      This event is fired during a call to DebugSession.terminate(), *before* this session is actually terminated.

    • Method Detail

      • isSafeToStart

        boolean isSafeToStart(DebugSession session)
        Once DSS has opened a debug session (after the onSessionOpening/Opened() events have been fired) it will call into this function and wait inside a "busy-loop" until isSafeToStart() returns true (or until a timeout occurs). When DSS terminating a session it will call into this function and wait inside a "busy-loop" until safeToTerminate() returns true. This prevents DSS (within the scripting console) from shutting down the DebugServer while the CCS GUI is still working on the session.

      • isSafeToTerminate

        boolean isSafeToTerminate(DebugSession session)
        Prior to DSS terminating a session (prior to the onSessionTerminating/Terminated() events being fired) it will call into this function and wait inside a "busy-loop" until safeToTerminate() returns true (or until a timeout occurs). This prevents DSS from shutting down the DebugServer while the hosted environment (CCS GUI) is still working on the session.

      • onServerStarted

        void onServerStarted(DebugServer server)
        This event is fired during the call to DebugServer.start(), immediatly *after* the call to IApplication.initialize(). If the underlying IApplicaiton was already started prior to calling DebugServer.start() then this event is skipped.

      • onServerStarting

        void onServerStarting(DebugServer server)
        This event is fired during the call to DebugServer.start(), *before* loading and initializing the underlying IApplication. If the underlying IApplication was already started prior to calling to DebugServer.start() then this event is skipped

      • onServerStopped

        void onServerStopped(DebugServer server)
        This event is fired during the call to DebugServer.stop(), immediatly *after* the call to IApplication.dispose(). If the underlying IApplicaiton was already stopped/disposed prior to calling DebugServer.stop() then this event is skipped.

      • onServerStopping

        void onServerStopping(DebugServer server)
        This event is fired during the call to DebugServer.stop(), *before* terminating any DebugSessions and *before* disposing the underlying IApplication. If the underlying IApplication was already stopped/disposed prior to calling DebugServer.stop() then this event is skipped.

      • onSessionOpened

        void onSessionOpened(DebugSession session)
        This event is fired during a call to DebugServer.openSession(), *after* the new session is opened (and cached). Note: After opening a session with a specified name (or search pattern) the opened session is cached until it is terminated. Subsequent calls to DebugServer.openSession() that match an already-open session will return the cached session and this event will *not* be fired.

      • onSessionOpening

        void onSessionOpening(java.lang.String sessionName,
                      java.lang.String configuration)
        This event is fired during a call to DebugServer.openSession(), *before* a new session is opened. This event is only fired if the name (or search pattern) passed to DebugServer.openSession() will result in a valid session being opened. If the specified name (or search pattern) do not match any configured device, then this event will not be fired. Note: After opening a session with a specified name (or search pattern) the opened session is cached until it is terminated. Subsequent calls to DebugServer.openSession() that match an already-open session will return the cached session and this event will *not* be fired.

      • onSessionTerminated

        void onSessionTerminated(DebugSession session)
        This event is fired during a call to DebugSession.terminate(), *after* the session has been terminated.

      • onSessionTerminating

        void onSessionTerminating(DebugSession session)
        This event is fired during a call to DebugSession.terminate(), *before* this session is actually terminated.
